Get a bouding box for and AOI

Source: R/getClip.R
getClip.Rd

getClip generates a Spatial object based on a point; bounding box dimisions; and their relation to the point.

getClip(location = NULL, width = NULL, height = NULL, origin = NULL)

Arguments

location

Defined by a location or lat, long pair
width

define the width of the desired bounding box in miles
height

define the height of the desired bounding box in miles
origin

define the position of the point with respect to the bounding box. Default is set to center. Options include

  • "center"

  • "lowerleft"

  • "lowerright"

  • "upperright"

  • "upperleft"

Value

a SpatialPolygons object projected to EPSG:4269.

Examples

# Get AOI defined by 10 mile bounding box using "UCSB" as the point
    getClip(location = "UCSB", width = 10, height = 10, origin = "center")
#> class       : SpatialPolygons 
#> features    : 1 
#> extent      : -119.9368, -119.7611, 34.3415, 34.48643  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +ellps=GRS80 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0+no_defs 

# Get AOI defined by 10 mile2 bounding box using the 'KMART near UCSB' as lower left corner
    getClip(clocation = NULL, width = NULL, height = NULL, origin = NULL)
#> Error in getClip(clocation = NULL, width = NULL, height = NULL, origin = NULL): unused argument (clocation = NULL)
